snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio confronted the dismay of New Yorkers upset about racial injustice and a campaign promise that he could heal the strained relations between minorities and the police.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, in extremely personal speech, expresses dismay that a white police officer will not be charged in death of Eric Garner and promises to improve tensions between police and minorities; remarks reflect both his obligation as mayor to maintain order amid protests and his personal concerns as father to children of color.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and NIKITA STEWART

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio confronted the dismay of New Yorkers upset about racial injustice and a campaign promise that he could heal the strained relations between minorities and the police.

headline.main: De Blasio Reacts as Mayor and a Father
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Reacts as Mayor and a Father
